weeklyEmail.teaser: Official email from the UT Austin Chapter of the Society of Physics Students

item.name: Halloween Meeting
item.info: Spooky! We'll have an informal Halloween-themed meeting this week, with demos and Fermi Problems! Costumes are certainly encouraged. See you there!

item.name: Jean Holloway Award for Teaching Excellence
item.info: Have a professor who goes above and beyond in the College of Natural Sciences or College of Liberal Arts? Nominate him or her for the Texas Exes' Jean Holloway Award for Teaching Excellence! UT students nominate professors using the online form, then a selection committee of your fellow students selects the winner based on nomination forms and class visits. The award is very prestigious (since it comes from students) and can be a turning point for a newer professor trying new things or a welcomed reward to a professor who has his or her own working formula.

item.name: T-shirt Ordering
item.info: For the first time, we are be conducting t-shirt sales online! Check out our website at http://www.ph.utexas.edu/~sps/pages/tshirts.html, where you can order via PayPal thanks to our webmaster, Tharon Morrison. We are also selling shirts in the Lobby of RLM this week! Want to help out (and receive half-price discounts for working 2 hours)? Sign up to volunteer here! This is a great opportunity for you to give back to SPS and help us continue providing the pizza every week, open house prizes, watermelon drops, and the other things that we do. Hope to see you there! Questions? Email us!

item.name: Open House Poster Contest!
item.info: October 29 is the final day to submit your poster information! Printing (see link) must be submitted before October 30! November 4th is the 2013 Annual Physics Department Open House, which means several things for you! First, if you have done research, you can submit a poster to the Open House Poster Contest! There will be prizes for the top posters as judged by a panel. Think you might be up to the challenge? Fill out this form to let us know! Check out links on the form for more details. We want a full list of posters in early October, so that they will be ready to print in late October. Questions? Email us!

item.name: Open House Volunteering!
item.info: We still need volunteers - particularly before 3pm! If you're free, please sign up to help!November 4th is the 2013 Annual Physics Department Open House and SPS is looking for a ton of people to help make this event a success. If you are not submitting a poster, but would still like to help out, you can sign up to be a volunteer. Volunteers will be greeting visitors and answering questions, selling t-shirts, and directing visitors to labs, elevators, and posters. You will also get Sigma Pi Sigma service hours for this event, so please sign up here!

item.name: Student-Led Spring PHY 110C Courses
item.info: It's official! The Department of Physics is offering two student-led courses next semester as PHY 110C! Unique ID 58911 (Professor Sitz) is with SPS President, Evan Ott, and LaTeX master Will Beason who will be leading an "Introduction to Data Analysis for Physics" course, geared as preparation for PHY 355L (Modern Lab / Junior Lab) with LaTeX and Mathematica. Unique ID 58913 (Professor Marder) is going to be led by Crystal Riley, on an "Introduction to Programming for Physics" using Python, geared to introduce you to concepts in programming that you can then apply in research or industry. Neither course presumes prior programming experience. For scheduling info, consult the Course Schedule, and for other questions, email us at spsofficers@gmail.com.

item.name: Mentoring Group
item.info: Group starts October 28! If you are interested in being mentored please sign up and get your friends to sign up too! You can sign up here to be a mentee and here to be a mentor. Email SPS Webmaster, Tharon Morrison at t_morrison@utexas.edu for more information.

item.name: League of Legends Tournament/LAN Party
item.info: Do you play LoL (League of Legends)? Want to play with some of your fellow physicists? SPS is hoping to host a LAN party / tournament of sorts in mid-November. If you're interested, you can sign up here and view results (other player's names, summoner names, etc.) here email SPS Webmaster, Tharon Morrison at t_morrison@utexas.edu

item.name: Sunday Night Study Session
item.info: It's back! Our Sunday Night Study Session (SNSS) is in full swing! For those who haven't been, every week we invite any and all physics majors and people in physics or math classes to come by to work on homework. With many upper-division students in attendance (and some LAs for classes), when you run into problems, you won't be stuck for long. We also provide cookies, coffee, tea, etc., to help keep you <s>caffeinated</s> energized. Some come by to help or be helped! If you're interested in tutoring, making known that you're available during the night (name on a chalkboard) is a great way to earn service hours for Sigma Pi Sigma.

item.name: Service Hours
item.info: Interested in joining Sigma Pi Sigma, the physics honors society? The requirements are listed on our website. For the service hour component, we will be managing that through the new HornsLink system (see below for the link). Join the SPS group and when you volunteer (like tutoring for SNSS above), submit a request for us to verify your service hours. That way, we have a nice record of volunteers and volunteer time (and it will show up on the resume HornsLink can create for you)! You input the time you worked, we sign off, then you don't have to think about it again!

item.name: Comments or Questions
item.info: Have something to complain about? Or a question? Maybe an idea for a meeting or event? Or suggestions about how we use technology? Contact us at spsofficers@gmail.com or see the links below! As always, Don't Forget To Be Awesome!
